Functions

void eol_graphics_init ()
 Initializes the graphics system for EOL. Will load up the default config file in system/graphics.cfg and set up the rending system based on the settings in the config file.
void eol_graphics_config ()
eolBool eol_graphics_initialized ()
 Query the graphics ready state.
void eol_resize_graphics (eolUint w, eolUint h, eolBool fs)
 relaunches the game screen in the new screen resolution. Invoked an registered callbacks.
void eol_graphics_register_resize (void(*callback)(eolGraphicsView info))
 Sets up a function that will be called after any change to the internal graphics settings is made. It will call the function once to set up initial states.
void eol_graphics_save_screen_shot (const char *file)
eolUint eol_index_color (eolUint color)
 Given an index, it returns a hex code that corresponds to that color.
void eol_graphics_frame_begin ()
 blanks the drawing buffer to the preset background color. Should be called befor starting any frame buffer drawing.
void eol_graphics_frame_end ()
 blit the contents of the draw buffer to the screen and toggle the draw buffers. It will prepare a freshly cleared drawing buffer for the next frame
eolUint eol_graphics_get_pixel (SDL_Surface *surface, eolUint x, eolUint y)
 returns the hax color value of the pixel at the given position in the provided sdl surface. Note that the surface will need to be locked while this operation is being performed.
void eol_graphics_put_pixel (SDL_Surface *surface, eolUint x, eolUint y, eolUint pixel)
 change a specific pixel in an SDL surface.
SDL_PixelFormat * eol_graphics_get_pixel_format ()
 retrieve the viewports active pixel format

#define EOL_Orange   0xEE5522

Definition at line 36 of file eol_graphics.h.

#define EOL_Red   0xDD0000

The Engine of Lies graphics library is designed to be the point of minimal entry into the engine. It wraps up initialization of graphical systems such as SDL and openGL and handles the calls to configure the graphics engine of the system.

Definition at line 370 of file eol_graphics.c.

eolUint eol_graphics_get_pixel ( SDL_Surface *  surface,
eolUint  x,
eolUint  y 
)

returns the hax color value of the pixel at the given position in the provided sdl surface. Note that the surface will need to be locked while this operation is being performed.

Parameters:
surface the sdl surface that holds the pixel data
x the x position to check
y the y position to check
Returns:
the hex color value of the color found.

Definition at line 375 of file eol_graphics.c.

retrieve the viewports active pixel format

Returns:
a pointer to the advice pixel format data. DO NOT WRITE TO IT.

eolUint  x,
eolUint  y,
eolUint  pixel 
)

change a specific pixel in an SDL surface.

Parameters:
surface a valid SDL_Surface that will be written to
x the x position in the image
y the y position in the image
pixel the hex value of the color to be drawn.

Definition at line 401 of file eol_graphics.c.

void eol_graphics_register_resize ( void(*)(eolGraphicsView info)  callback  ) 

Sets up a function that will be called after any change to the internal graphics settings is made. It will call the function once to set up initial states.

Parameters:
callback the function to be invoked when the graphics are resized.

Definition at line 425 of file eol_graphics.c.

Given an index, it returns a hex code that corresponds to that color.

Parameters:
color the color from eol_colors
Returns:
the hex EOL_defined useful in direct graphics calls.

Definition at line 263 of file eol_graphics.c.

void eol_resize_graphics ( eolUint  w,
eolUint  h,
eolBool  fs 
)

relaunches the game screen in the new screen resolution. Invoked an registered callbacks.

Parameters:
w the new width for the screen
h the new height for the screen
fs set true for fullscreen mode or false for window mode.
